ttl.name: VEHICLE STABILITY CONTROL SYSTEM(w/ Pre-collision System)

para.dtcname: Brake System Control Module "A" Internal Electronic Failure
Left Front Wheel ABS Hold Solenoid Control Circuit Voltage Out of Range
Left Front Wheel ABS Release Solenoid Control Circuit Voltage Out of Range
Right Front Wheel ABS Hold Solenoid Control Circuit Voltage Out of Range
Right Front Wheel ABS Release Solenoid Control Circuit Voltage Out of Range
Left Rear Wheel ABS Hold Solenoid Control Circuit Voltage Out of Range
Left Rear Wheel ABS Release Solenoid Control Circuit Voltage Out of Range
Right Rear Wheel ABS Hold Solenoid Control Circuit Voltage Out of Range
Right Rear Wheel ABS Release Solenoid Control Circuit Voltage Out of Range
Left Front Wheel ABS Hold Solenoid / Right Front Wheel ABS Hold Solenoid Signal Compare Failure
Left Rear Wheel ABS Hold Solenoid / Right Rear Wheel ABS Hold Solenoid Signal Compare Failure
Brake Pressure Control Solenoid A/B Signal Compare Failure
Brake Pressure Control Solenoid "A" Control Circuit Voltage Out of Range
Brake Pressure Control Solenoid "B" Control Circuit Voltage Out of Range

content5.ptxt: These DTCs are stored when a problem is determined in the skid control ECU (brake actuator assembly).

The brake actuator assembly solenoids turn on when signals are received from the skid control ECU (brake actuator assembly) and they control the pressure acting on the wheel cylinders to control the braking force.

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Brake System Control Module "A" Internal Electronic Failure

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: When the +BS terminal voltage is from 9.5 to 17.4 V and the solenoid relay is ON, the relay contact is ON and the pump motor is in a low voltage state continuously for 0.1 seconds or more.

item.ptxt: Solenoid circuit
Solenoid valve (Brake actuator assembly)

data-name.name: dtc-code
data-name.ptxt: C12A51C

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Left Front Wheel ABS Hold Solenoid Control Circuit Voltage Out of Range

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: Any of the following is detected:

item.ptxt: When the +BS terminal voltage is 17.4 V or less while holding solenoid (SFLH) outputs OFF, open circuit continues for 0.05 seconds or more.
When the +BS terminal voltage is 17.4 V or less while holding solenoid (SFLH) outputs OFF, current is maintained for 0.05 seconds or more.
When the +BS terminal voltage is 17.4 V or less while holding solenoid (SFLH) outputs ON, overcurrent continues for 0.1 seconds or more.
When the +BS terminal voltage is 17.4 V or less while holding solenoid (SFLH) outputs ON, open circuit continues for 0.05 seconds or more.
Solenoid circuit
Solenoid valve (Brake actuator assembly)

data-name.ptxt: C12B01C

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Left Front Wheel ABS Release Solenoid Control Circuit Voltage Out of Range

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: Either of the following is detected:

item.ptxt: When the +BS terminal voltage is 17.4 V or less while decompression solenoid (SFLR) outputs OFF, decompression solenoid (SFLR) is ON continuously for 0.05 seconds or more.
When the +BS terminal voltage is 17.4 V or less while decompression solenoid (SFLR) outputs ON, decompression solenoid (SFLR) is OFF continuously for 0.05 seconds or more.
Solenoid circuit
Solenoid valve (Brake actuator assembly)

data-name.name: dtc-code
data-name.ptxt: C13C01C

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Brake Pressure Control Solenoid "A" Control Circuit Voltage Out of Range

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: Any of the following is detected:

item.ptxt: When the +BS terminal voltage is 17.4 V or less while switching solenoid (SM1) is on, overcurrent continues for 0.1 seconds or more.
When the +BS terminal voltage is 17.4 V or less while switching solenoid (SM1) is off, an open circuit continues for 0.05 seconds or more.
When the +BS terminal voltage is 17.4 V or less while switching solenoid (SM1) is on, an open circuit continues for 0.05 seconds or more.
When the +BS terminal voltage is 17.4 V or less while switching solenoid (SM1) is off, current continues to be applied for 0.05 seconds or more.
Solenoid circuit
Solenoid valve (Brake actuator assembly)

data-name.name: dtc-code
data-name.ptxt: C13C91C

data-name.name: detect-item

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: Any of the following is detected:

item.ptxt: When the +BS terminal voltage is 17.4 V or less while switching solenoid (SM2) is on, overcurrent continues for 0.1 seconds or more.
When the +BS terminal voltage is 17.4 V or less while switching solenoid (SM2) is off, an open circuit continues for 0.05 seconds or more.
When the +BS terminal voltage is 17.4 V or less while switching solenoid (SM2) is on, an open circuit continues for 0.05 seconds or more.
When the +BS terminal voltage is 17.4 V or less while switching solenoid (SM2) is off, current continues to be applied for 0.05 seconds or more.
Solenoid circuit
Solenoid valve (Brake actuator assembly)

While holding solenoid (SFLH) outputs ON, open circuit continues

atten3.ptxt: After replacing the skid control ECU (brake actuator assembly), perform "Calibration".

atten4.ptxt: These codes are detected when a problem is determined in the skid control ECU (brake actuator assembly).
The solenoid circuits are in the skid control ECU (brake actuator assembly).
Therefore, solenoid circuit inspection and solenoid unit inspection cannot be performed. Be sure to check if any DTCs are output before replacing the skid control ECU (brake actuator assembly).

test1.ptxt: Check if the same DTC is recorded.

entry.ptxt: DTCs C059749, C12A51C, C12B01C, C12BB1C, C12C61C, C12D11C, C12DC1C, C12E71C, C12F21C, C12F662, C12F762, C13BF62, C13C01C and C13C91C are not output.
DTCs C059749, C12A51C, C12B01C, C12BB1C, C12C61C, C12D11C, C12DC1C, C12E71C, C12F21C, C12F662, C12F762, C13BF62, C13C01C and/or C13C91C are output.

item.ptxt: If a speed signal of 20 km/h (12 mph) or more is input to the skid control ECU (brake actuator assembly), with the ignition switch ON and the stop light switch off, the ECU performs self diagnosis of the motor and solenoid circuits.

If the normal system code is output (the trouble code is not output), slightly jiggle the connectors, wire harness, and fuses of the skid control ECU (brake actuator assembly). Make sure that no DTCs are output.
If any DTCs are output while jiggling a connector or wire harness from the skid control ECU (brake actuator assembly), inspect and repair the connector or wire harness.
The DTCs were probably output due to a bad connection of the connector terminal.
